messages.content:
You are evaluating a candidate profile to decide if we should reach out.

Judge the candidate on:

**Educational Pedigree**
• Bachelor's degree is the strongest pedigree signal.
• Selectivity and prestige of the undergrad institution is weighted most heavily.
• A top-tier CS/Engineering bachelor's degree = Great.
• A mid-tier or unselective bachelor's program = Average/Weak, regardless of later graduate study.
• Graduate degrees (MS, MBA, etc.) add value only if earned at a top school.
• A top-tier MS in CS/Engineering = Good/Great.
• A mid-tier MS is not a strong signal and can actually lower pedigree compared to no MS.
• PhD in CS/Engineering = always Good, but from a top-tier school = Great or Excellent.
• Technical majors (CS, EE, Software Engineering, related fields) are favored. Non-technical degrees are weaker, even at strong schools.

**Company Pedigree**
• Brand and caliber of employers (tier-1 tech, high-growth startups, selective teams, notable acquisitions).

**Trajectory**
• Speed and consistency of promotions relative to years of experience.
• Engineers with >8 years should typically be ≥ Senior SWE.
• Engineers with >12 years should typically be ≥ Staff SWE.
• Faster than these milestones = stronger trajectory. Slower = weaker trajectory.

**Is Software Engineer**
• Confirm titles and responsibilities are software engineering.

Return a concise recommendation and rationales. Ground reasoning in evidence from the profile.

**Candidate:** Min Thet K
**Current Role:** Software Engineer at Bloomberg
**Location:** New York, New York, United States

**Work History:**
• Software Engineer at Bloomberg (2023-07 - 1970-01-01)
• Graduate Teaching Assistant - 6.1910 (Computation Structures) at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2023-02 - 2023-05)
• Graduate Teaching Assistant - 6.1910 (Computation Structures) at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2022-09 - 2022-12)
• Software Engineer Intern at Bloomberg (2022-06 - 2022-08)
• Graduate Teaching Assistant - 6.0004 (Introduction to Low-Level Programming in C and Assembly) at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2022-02 - 2022-05)
• Software Engineer at Microsoft (2021-04 - 2022-01)
• Learning Assistant - 6.004 (Computation Structures) at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2020-09 - 2020-12)
• Learning Technologist - MIT Global Languages at MIT Open Learning (2020-06 - 2020-10)
• Undergraduate Teaching Assistant - 6.004 (Computation Structures) at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2020-02 - 2020-05)
• Software Engineer Intern at Microsoft (2019-05 - 2019-08)
• Learning Assistant - 6.004 (Computation Structures) at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (2019-02 - 2019-05)
• Robotics Engineering Intern at Dexai Robotics (2018-06 - 2018-08)

**Education:**
• Bachelor of Science - BS in Computer Science from Massachusetts Institute of Technology
• Master of Engineering - MEng in Computer Science from Massachusetts Institute of Technology

**Required JSON Response Format:**
{
  "recommendation": "Strong Yes | Yes | Maybe | No | Strong No",
  "reasoning": "<1–2 sentence overall summary>",
  "analysis": {
    "educational_pedigree": {
      "rating": "Great | Good | Average | Weak | None",
      "reasoning": "<explain how bachelor's, grad, and/or PhD pedigree influenced the rating>"
    },
    "company_pedigree": {
      "rating": "Great | Good | Average | Weak | None",
      "reasoning": "<employer quality explanation>"
    },
    "trajectory": {
      "rating": "Great | Good | Average | Weak | None",
      "reasoning": "<promotion speed vs experience thresholds>"
    },
    "is_software_engineer": {
      "value": true,
      "reasoning": "<titles/responsibilities that confirm SWE focus>"
    }
  }
}

Analyze the candidate according to the criteria above and provide your evaluation in the exact JSON format specified.

You are evaluating a candidate profile to decide if we should reach out.

• A mid-tier MS is not a strong signal and can actually lower pedigree compared to no MS.
• PhD in CS/Engineering = always Good, but from a top-tier school = Great or Excellent.
• Technical majors (CS, EE, Software Engineering, related fields) are favored. Non-technical degrees are weaker, even at strong schools.

**Company Pedigree**
• Brand and caliber of employers (tier-1 tech, high-growth startups, selective teams, notable acquisitions).

**Trajectory**
• Speed and consistency of promotions relative to years of experience.
• Engineers with >8 years should typically be ≥ Senior SWE.
• Engineers with >12 years should typically be ≥ Staff SWE.
• Faster than these milestones = stronger trajectory. Slower = weaker trajectory.

**Is Software Engineer**
• Confirm titles and responsibilities are software engineering.

Return a concise recommendation and rationales. Ground reasoning in evidence from the profile.

**Candidate:** Shu-Huai Lin
**Current Role:** Software Engineer at Google
**Location:** Baltimore City County, Maryland, United States

**Work History:**
• Software Engineer at Google (2022-08 - 1970-01-01)
• Software Engineer Intern at Microsoft (2021-06 - 2021-08)
• Research Assistant at University of Maryland (2020-08 - 2022-05)
• Head Teaching Assistant at University of Maryland (2020-08 - 2022-05)
• Software Developer Intern at Microsoft (2020-06 - 2020-08)
• Campus Tour Guide at Maryland IMAGES Campus Tour Guides (2020-03 - 2021-05)
• Vice President at UMD Advanced Cybersecurity Experience for Students (2019-05 - 2020-05)
• Uncleared Intern Research Contractor at University of Maryland (2019-05 - 2019-08)
• Executive Director at Bitcamp (2019-04 - 2020-05)
• Organizer at Technica (2019-03 - 2021-12)
• Machine Learning Intern at University of Wyoming College of Engineering and Applied Science (2018-12 - 2019-01)
• Logistics Organizer at Bitcamp (2018-12 - 2019-05)
• Freshman Coordinator at UMD Advanced Cybersecurity Experience for Students (2018-10 - 2019-05)
• Computational Neuroscience Intern at University of Maryland Medical School (2018-07 - 2018-07)
• fMRI Neuroimaging Intern at National Institute of Drug Abuse (NIDA) (2017-06 - 2017-08)

**Education:**
• Master of Science - MS in Computer Science from University of Maryland
• Bachelor of Science - BS in Mathematics and Computer Science from University of Maryland
